intro: Trilopus hyemalis, commonly known as the winter cress, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is characterized by its small, pinnately divided leaves and yellow flowers. It produces small, round, seed-containing pods that are often used in traditional herbal medicine. Trilopus hyemalis is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in cold climates.
